intro: Diphasia morogorensis, commonly known as the Morogoro milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant has thick, succulent stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including mammals and insects. Diphasia morogorensis is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
